'''Dr. Whitehouse''' was Pete and Violet's marriage counselor.

==History==
Pete and Violet decided to start working on their marriage with the aid of a couples counselor. They chose Dr. Whitehouse after two other therapists weren't a good fit. He started their session by asking them what initially drew each of them to the other.

In another session, they argued about the case of [[Drea Spencer]] and how they disagreed over things. Whitehouse watched them argue and Pete said he looked smug. Whitehouse said that he was just hopeful for them. The fighting was ugly, but it was better than just being polite because being polite wouldn't give their marriage a chance.

Whitehouse suggested unpacking everything that had been revealed in their last session. Pete said that he thought the problem they were having was that they disagreed about how to get to a good place. He wanted to just laugh and play and love each other instead of unpacking all their issues. He kissed her and left the office.

==Career==
He is a therapist who does couples counseling.
